page.title: 09THE DAYLIGHT INN, PETTS WOOD
page.content: The {Daylight Inn} was built in 1935 and named after the ideas of {William Willett} who fought the campaign for {daylight saving}. It is built in Tudor style with lattice windows and white walls. The {inn sign} explains daylight saving. There is a picture of the sun and at either side there is a clock. One of the clocks says twelve o'clock and the other says one o'clock. There are two arrows near the edge to show that in spring the clocks are put forward and in autumn the clocks are put back. Inside the inn there are thirteen bedrooms, a hall where banquets and dancing are held, and a stage where amateur plays can be performed.
